tool.name: CONCOCT
tool.command:
## CONCOCT doesn't handle gzipped files. #if $composition_file.ext.endswith(".gz") gunzip -c '$composition_file' > 'composition_file.fa' && #else: ln -s '$composition_file' 'composition_file.fa' && #end if
mkdir outdir && concoct --coverage_file '$coverage_file' --composition_file 'composition_file.fa' --clusters $advanced.clusters --kmer_length $advanced.kmer_length --threads \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} --length_threshold $advanced.length_threshold --read_length $advanced.read_length --total_percentage_pca $advanced.total_percentage_pca --basename 'outdir/' --seed $advanced.seed --iterations $advanced.iterations $advanced.no_cov_normalization $output.no_total_coverage --no_original_data $output.converge_out

param.label: Coverage file
param.help: Table where each row correspond to a contig, and each column correspond to a sample. The values are the average coverage for this contig in that sample

param.label: Composition file with sequences
param.help: It is named the composition file since it is used to calculate the kmer composition (the genomic signature) of each contig.

param.label: Maximum number of clusters for the Variational Gaussian Mixture Model (VGMM) algorithm
Sequence length threshold
param.help: Contigs shorter than this value will not be included

param.label: Percentage of variance explained by the principal components for the combined data
Seed for clustering
param.help: Zero value will use random seed

param.label: Maximum number of iterations for the Variational Bayes Gaussian Mixture Models (VBGMM)
Skip normalization and only do log transorm of the coverage?
param.help: By default, the coverage is normalized for samples, then normalized for contigs and finally log transformed. By setting this flag you skip the normalization and only do log transorm of the coverage.

param.label: Eliminate the total coverage column from the coverage data matrix?
param.help: By default, total coverage is included, independently of coverage normalization but previous to log transformation. Use this tag to escape this behaviour.

tool.help:
**What it does**
CONCOCT (Clustering cONtigs with COverage and ComposiTion) performs unsupervised binning of metagenomic contigs by using nucleotide composition - kmer frequencies - and coverage data for multiple samples. CONCOCT can accurately (up to species level) bin metagenomic contigs.
The tool accepts 2 inputs; a tabular file where each row corresponds to a contig and each column corresponds to a sample (the values are the average coverage for this contig in that sample) and a file containing sequences in fasta format.
Three outputs are produced; clustering of the > 1000 kmer count, the PCA transformed matrix and the PCA components.
